intro: Lepia hirta, commonly known as the hairy lepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Lepia hirta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
